action.action-desc: Mr. Ruiz introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify that caregivers for veterans with serious illnesses are eligible for assistance and support services provided by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Support Our Services to Veterans Caregivers Act or the S.O.S. Veterans Caregivers Act.

section.header: Improvements to services provided to caregivers of veterans

subsection.header: Caregivers of veterans with serious illnesses
subsection.text: Paragraph (2)(B) of section 1720G(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting illness or after serious each place it appears.

subsection.header: Assessing caregiver and veteran burden and satisfaction

paragraph.text: Paragraph (3)(A)(ii) of such section is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subclause (V), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in subclause (VI)(bb), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subclause:

subclause.text: not less than annually, a multidimensional assessment to measure, in both objective and subjective terms, the burden and strain felt by the family caregiver.

paragraph.text: Section 101(c)(2)(B) of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 (Public Law 111–163; 38 U.S.C. 1720G note) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (iii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: a description of the satisfaction experienced by caregivers and veterans with respect to such program, including any findings regarding whether such program reduces the burden and strain felt by caregivers.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to services provided after the date of the enactment of this Act.
